definitions.definition: Characteristic of, or in the manner of, an adversary ; combative , hostile , opposed .
In which issues are tried through the presentation of evidence and argument by adverse parties, with no or limited inquiry by the court's own initiative.
examples: Canada uses an adversarial system of criminal justice, whereas France uses an inquisitorial model.

main_definition: Characteristic of, or in the manner of, an adversary ; combative , hostile , opposed .
secondary_definitions: ( law ) In which issues are tried through the presentation of evidence and argument by adverse parties, with no or limited inquiry by the court's own initiative.
